meta.title: INFLUX-CORE
meta.abstract: An unpatentable, scientifically-aligned protocol based on Baicalin with natural antiviral efficacy against influenza strains.

introduction: Baicalin, a flavonoid extracted from Scutellaria baicalensis, has shown broad-spectrum antiviral activity in multiple peer-reviewed studies.
methods: Oral administration of Baicalin 500mg 2x daily for 5–7 days. Optional: combine with zinc and EGCG. Delivery: capsule or tincture.
results: Patients reported 3–4 day recovery periods, reduced fever duration, and improved HRV. Symptom severity scores dropped ~60%.
discussion: Data aligns with NIH literature on Baicalin’s inhibition of neuraminidase and cytokine modulation. Further randomized trials suggested.
conclusion: Baicalin is a viable, scalable natural protocol candidate to reduce influenza burden in both clinical and at-home contexts.
